File libsrc/libgODBC/ODBCRequestIds.c

Routines to request ids from the lastid table.

Public Function Index

Get an id (keyvalue) from the lastid table and increment it.

Public Functions

ODBCGetNextId 
 int ODBCGetNextId(SQLHDBC hdbc,
                   const char *tableName,
                   const char *keyname)
Get an id (keyvalue) from the lastid table and increment it. The id is taken from the recycled-id-list, if available. Otherwise, the keyvalue of the lastid record corresponding to the tableName and keyname is returned and increased by the idIncrement value. The idIncrement defaults to 1 for all keynames. Use ODBCSetRequestIdIncrement to set the idIncrement.

Parameters:
hdbc - The SQLHDBC connection handle obtained from ODBCConnect()
tableName - The name of the lastid table including the account, if necessary.
keyname - The lastid keyname ("arid", "orid", etc.).
Returns:
The keyvalue (next id) or -1 for failure. Retrieve the error number and error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
ODBCNumberIDsAvailable 
 int ODBCNumberIDsAvailable(const char *keyname)
Get the number of recycled ids available. For the input keyname, return the number of ids in the recycled-id-list.

Parameters:
keyname - The lastid keyname ("arid", "orid", etc.).
Returns:
The number of ids in the recycled-id-list.
ODBCRecycleIds 
 int ODBCRecycleIds(const char *keyname,
                    int *ids,
                    int numReturned)
Recycle ids from the lastid table. Give ids to the recycle list to be used by ODBCGetNextId and ODBCRequestIds.

Parameters:
keyname - The lastid keyname ("arid", "orid", etc.).
ids - An array of ids.
numReturned - The number ids to put in the recycle list.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 if malloc fails. Retrieve the error number and error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
ODBCRequestIds 
 int ODBCRequestIds(SQLHDBC hdbc,
                    const char *tableName,
                    const char *keyname,
                    int numRequested,
                    int consecutive,
                    int *ids,
                    int *numReturned)
Request one or more ids from the lastid table. The requested number of ids are taken from the recycled-id-list, if available. If necessary, ids are taken from the lastid table. The keyvalue of the lastid table is incremented by the larger of the number of ids needed or the idIncrement.

Parameters:
hdbc - The SQLHDBC connection handle obtained from ODBCConnect().
tableName - The name of the lastid table including the account, if necessary.
keyname - The lastid keyname ("arid", "orid", etc.).
numRequested - The number of ids requested.
consecutive - Set to 1 to request consecutive ids. Set to 0 to request any available ids.
ids - An array to hold the returned numRequested ids.
numReturned - The actual number of ids returned in ids.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 for failure. Retrieve the error number and error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
ODBCSetRequestIdIncrement 
 int ODBCSetRequestIdIncrement(const char *keyname,
                               int idIncrement)
Set the lastid request increment for keyname. For the input keyname, set the minimum number of ids that will actually be requested from the lastid table each time a request is made with ODBCGetNextId or ODBCRequestIds. Extra ids are saved in the recycle list.

Parameters:
keyname - The keyname of the lastid record ("arid", "orid", etc.).
increment - The minimum number of ids to request from the database.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 if increment <= 0 or malloc fails. Retrieve the error number and error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
ODBCUpdateLastid 
 int ODBCUpdateLastid(SQLHDBC hdbc,
                      const char *tableName,
                      const char *keyname,
                      int numRequested,
                      int *keyvalue)
Update the lastid table. The keyvalue of the lastid table is returned in keyvalue and incremented by numRequested.

Parameters:
hdbc - The SQLHDBC connection handle obtained from ODBCConnect().
tableName - The name of the lastid table including account if necessary.
keyname - The lastid keyname ("arid", "orid", etc.).
numRequested - The number of ids requested.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 for error. Retrieve the error number and error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
